__TOC__

* Contact: <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~ddrichardson|Dougie Richardson]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/~sguest|Stuart Guest]]</nowiki>
* Brand: eMachines
* Make : N-12
* Model: W340UA
* Website: http://uk.emachines.com/
* S/N: Only needed if you have a Canonical supplied laptop

=== Hardware details ===

* AMD Sempron 3200+ (1.6GHz/800MHz)
* 256MB DDR2 Memory as supplied, 768MB Installed (128MB allocated to video)
* 40GB HDD 4200 RPM
* DVD/CD-RW Combo Drive
* 14.1" XGA TFT Screen
* nVIDIA GeForce Go 6100 128MB DDR2 (Shared)
* 56k Modem
* LAN (nVidia MCP51)
* WLAN (RTL-8185 IEEE 802.11a/b/g Wireless)
* Card reader
* UK Keyboard

=== Current Issues ===
Will not run Gutsy Gibbon live cd - boots into X then hangs. Virtual consoles respond on initial keystrokes but hang within a few inputs.

==== Notes ====

Great little laptop, cheap (available in ASDA supermarkets.

No longer in production - dropped from eMachines in UK.

Also known as Gateway MX3412.

If the Wireless NIC doesn't appear to work, check /etc/modules and make sure that the "ndiswrapper" module is included.
